result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Joel Madrigal Sr

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Joel Madrigal Sr in court.  Attorney Rebecca M Coffee in court for Joel Madrigal Sr.  Attorney Josh Milder in court for State of Wisconsin. Case in court for Deferred Prosecution Agreement hearing. 
Court is in receipt of  the Deferred Prosecution Agreement; Plea Questionnaire, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and jury instructions of the Offense.
State advised the Court they have complied with the Victims' Rights Law. 
As to Count 1:
The parties have agreed to a deferred judgment agreement. 
The defendant was advised of his constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and entered a plea of GUILTY
Defendant  examined as to the plea.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  
The Court found the defendant guilty but WITHHELD entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
The Court reviewed the Early Intervention Program Deferred Prosecution Agreement with the defendant.  
The court approved the Deferred Prosecution Agreement and ordered the proceedings suspended until Review Hearing.  
Parties informed this matter has been reassigned to Judge Stark, Br. 17. Review Hearing scheduled
Review hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Joel Madrigal in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  Julie D Knyszek appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Pretrial Conference held.  Defense counsel requests DPA hearing date.  Case adjourned, Br. 41.  Deferred prosecution agreement hearing scheduled for September 8, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Received and Filed. Deferred Prosecution Agreement
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff's Department 5/29/2022

Cash bond previously posted to be returned to remitter. 
Court ordered Defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MCM.

Defendant Joel Madrigal in court with attorney Rebecca M Coffee.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Rosa, Branch 35.  
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause. Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney. Defendant plead not guilty.  
Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 35.
Parties are advised that effective August 1, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Audrey Skwierawski, Branch 41 in Room 501 of the Courthouse.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 18, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057717,
Payable Number: 1015028,
Receipt Number: 22RP025282,
Amount: $20.00
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 7-5-2022 @1p
Defendant is Out-of-Custody. Court appearance in Out-Of-Custody Court, Room 221 Safety Building on 07/05/2022@1pm
